;在臭名昭著的“海”中，一场车辆抛锚悲剧夺去了四名游客的生命中国新疆维吾尔自治区的“死亡”沙漠引发了人们对毫无准备的旅行的危险的警告。

;

;据国家旅游局称，7月22日，四人未经授权驾车驶入罗布泊野骆驼国家级自然保护区后死亡。大陆官方媒体《环球时报》。

;

;他们于 7 月 26 日失踪，后来发现他们旅行时没有卫星电话，也缺乏后勤支持。

;

;当他们的尸体被找到时一名参与救援的救援人员告诉澎湃新闻，7月27日，他们的车里没有剩下饮用水。

;

;这场悲剧引发了关于冒险进入极端户外环境的危险的讨论毫无准备，并且需要了解如何在极端条件下生存的信息。

;

;《华盛顿邮报》询问了中国灾害与应急救援医学会搜救专家、高级医疗官员黄成和罗兰·沙曼拥有15年户外领导力和风险管理经验的HKOutsider创始人，分享一些重要的安全提示。

;

;

;

;黄说，卫星电话、指南针和地图是必不可少的，因为以及轻便、透气、防晒的衣服、高帮靴子和防沙鞋套。

;

;他还建议多喝水，比你需要的多10%到12%，再加上高能量

;

;此外，还应准备一个急救箱，内含治疗中暑、痢疾、蛇咬伤、食物中毒和心血管问题的药物。

;

;在车辆方面，黄说，只有高素质的司机才应该冒险进入沙漠。

;

;

;

;“拥有一位熟悉您所旅行地区的经验丰富的导游非常重要。不要依赖网络信息。”黄说。

;

;Sharman 同意人们在前往沙漠地区之前应该进行自己的研究。他们还应与旅行社核实是否已做好应对危险情况的准备。

;

;对于应对气候波动，黄说，沙漠应做好应对极热和寒冷的准备。

;

; >;

;他说，在这两种情况下，最重要的是确保与外界保持联系，如果出现问题，请立即寻求帮助。

;

;Sharman 表示，对于气温超过40摄氏度，最重要的是保持水分。

;

;“除了多喝水外，您还应该在旅行前做好准备，不要喝咖啡和酒精，因为它们都会导致脱水，”他说

;

;

;

;黄表示，通过观察昆虫的行为，可以发现即将到来的强降雨和洪水的线索，一旦出现这样的天气，它们就会成群结队地聚集。大雨期间应避开山谷。

;

;他补充说，如果卫星电话出现故障，可以使用烟雾信号来暴露您的位置。

;

;“用树枝或树枝标记您的踪迹。从你的衣服上撕下的条子。这不仅可以帮助救援人员找到你，还可以防止你迷路。”他说。

;

;Sharman 说，在离开之前查看天气预报至关重要。

;

;他补充说，应携带防水袋来保护电子设备和备用用品。头灯也很有用。

;

;他说，如果发生雷暴，如果在山峰或山脊上，你应该立即下坡，并远离高大的树木和其他吸引闪电的物体。

;尽管南海争端持续存在，但中国与菲律宾之间的经济关系专家表示，虽然“一切照旧”，但风险也在上升。

;

;多年来，中国一直是菲律宾最大的贸易伙伴和最大的进口供应商。菲律宾统计局的数据显示，2023年上半年，中国超过美国和日本，成为菲律宾最大的出口市场。

;

;“‘经济热、政治冷’这句话准确地说马尼拉雅典耀大学历史系教授 Severo C. Madrona Jnr 表示：“菲律宾和中国之间的关系尽管存在政治问题或分歧，但仍拥有牢固的经济联系。”

;< p>;“即使政治关系很困难，合作有时也可能源于务实的商业目标，因为这两个领域的动态不一定直接相关，”他说。

;

;菲律宾的 Marcos Jnr 表示，华南地区中国海关数据显示，电子零部件、钢铁等工业产品、机械和矿产是双边贸易的最大领域。

;;

;因此，2017年中国与东盟贸易总额中与菲律宾的贸易额占比下降至13.96%。同期，这一比例低于一年前的 15.85%。

;

;对于这个岛国来说，尽管在总统小费迪南德·马科斯 (Ferdinand Marcos Jnr) 的领导下，与中国的双边关系正在经历重置 — — 相比之下，他与华盛顿的关系更加密切与他的前任罗德里戈·杜特尔特（Rodrigo Duterte）的合作——过去几个月，菲律宾与中国的经济联系似乎得到了加强。

;

;立法者敦促菲律宾需要新的贸易协议来摆脱中国

;

;一月份，在对北京进行为期三天的访问期间，小马科斯与习近平主席签署了 14 项协议，从基础设施投资到新鲜榴莲进口。

;

;由于需求疲软，中国的出口行业一直面临压力过去几个月西方的去风险努力也一直在转向通过北京的“一带一路”倡议加强与新兴经济体的贸易关系。该贸易计划将各经济体连接到一个以中国为中心的贸易网络​​，其中包括菲律宾。

;

;就两国之间的经济关系而言，基本上“一切如常”，安德里亚·克洛伊·黄 (Andrea Chloe Wong) 表示。菲律宾外交学院前高级研究员。

;

;“对于菲律宾来说，马科斯希望建立亲切、活跃的商业关系，鼓励商业投资，不受政治影响，”黄说，她拥有新西兰坎特伯雷大学政治学博士学位。

;

;但她补充说，如果中国成为更具主导性的经济伙伴，马尼拉也对北京利用贸易作为惩罚措施持谨慎态度。

;

;2012年黄岩岛对峙期间，两国双边关系紧张最严重，北京方面实施了更严格的控制，限制从菲律宾进口香蕉，声称这些香蕉含有粉虱。

;

; >;

;“如果南海再次爆发紧张局势，香蕉出口禁令......可能会重复，”黄说。

;

;周日，菲律宾谴责中国海警据称向南海发射水炮。其船只靠近有争议的南沙群岛，称这些行为是“非法的”和“危险的”。北京反过来敦促马尼拉从该岛的礁石上移走一艘“非法”搁浅的军舰。

;

;一些菲律宾立法者最近向马科斯政府施加压力，要求其避开中国公司和产品，以作为报复马尼拉大都会亚太进步之路基金会研究员亚伦·拉贝纳 (Aaron Rabena) 表示，尽管双边经济关系的风险正在上升，但对中国产品的抵制仍然存在。不太可能实现，因为很难取代中国作为“替代性大市场”。

;

;他说，更现实的是，立法者可能会对整体双边经济关系进行更严格的审查，作为一种正式的报复形式。

;

;澳大利亚新南威尔士大学东南亚专业名誉教授卡尔·塞耶表示，菲律宾呼吁抵制中国商品的呼声是“弄巧成拙”。

;< h3>;中国出口在 2024 年之前将保持疲软：7 月贸易数据的 4 个要点

;

;另一方面，中国现在可以通过切断前往菲律宾的团体旅游或进口来进行报复，或者作为对抵制的回应菲律宾香蕉。

;

;“目前，我认为没有任何危险会发展到这种程度。”

;

;爱德华多·阿拉拉尔 (Eduardo Araral)，国家国立大学公共政策副教授新加坡大学表示，如果迫于压力，中国可以使用经济手段进行报复，但只能是渐进式的。

;

;“我不会称其为全场紧逼。我将其称为针灸方法 - 他们会放入一根针，如果不起作用，他们会放入另一根针。”

;在北京不断壮大的军事力量之际，一艘台湾武装海岸警卫队船只罕见地访问日本港口

;

;日本于 1972 年从台北转而与北京建立外交关系，此前在两岸关系政策上一直极为谨慎，并且基本上不愿意在台湾问题上公开对抗中国大陆。< /p>;

;一位观察家表示，随着东京对其可能卷入的两岸冲突变得越来越警惕，此次港口访问代表着台湾和日本之间更加牢固的非官方关系。

;

;1,900-根据全球船舶追踪器 Marine Traffic 的数据，吨位 Hsun Hu No. 8 号周二在东京湾停靠，在离开台湾南部城市高雄后已经航行了 23 天多。

;

;该网站的实时追踪地图显示这艘悬挂台湾国旗的渔政巡逻船周三仍停留在东京湾。

;

;台湾海岸警卫队证实，巡湖八号停靠在东京晴海码头“进行例行公务”

;

;“为加强渔业巡逻，保障渔权……海巡署……通过荀湖8号离开高雄港，执行第二次公海巡逻任务。”该船于 7 月 15 日抵达台湾，预计于 9 月 12 日返回台湾。”该公司在周三的一份声明中表示。

;

;政府没有透露此次港口停靠是否早就计划好了。除非遇到紧急情况或躲避热带风暴，否则台湾官方船只很少停靠东京或任何其他日本港口。

;

;台湾与日本建立了相互登船检查机制，美国、新西兰、库克群岛、法国和澳大利亚，代表台北加强国际参与和巩固其公海渔业资源保护。

;

;全球前七强海军中，亚洲占五席。新加坡排名第24

;

;巡虎8号于2013年3月服役，装备武器包括一门T-75S 20毫米机炮、四挺T90重机枪、三挺T-75轻机枪、五挺乌兹冲锋枪冲锋枪、五支 T65K2 步枪和十支 T75 手枪。

;

;最后一次有报道称，台湾海岸警卫队曾在 2013 年 8 月停靠东京港口，也是为了补给，当时台湾海岸警卫队无意中透露，它已请求了“寻呼 8 号”当时停靠在东京的一艘台湾渔船在西太平洋协助发生兵变事件，导致一名台湾渔船船长和工程师被杀。

;

;当地新闻媒体报道称，台湾渔船的最新停靠点晴海码头的海岸警卫队船只引起了当地人的注意。一些人表示，这是他们第一次看到来自该岛的官方船只停靠在东京港口。

;

;此次停靠港口之际，日本前首相麻生太郎即将结束对日本为期三天的访问。周三台湾。访问期间，他会见了蔡英文和她的副手赖清德等台湾领导人，并在新北的已故总统李登辉的坟墓前向他致敬。

;

;周二，麻生太郎——自1972年以来访问台湾的日本执政党自民党最资深的政治家——在台北安全论坛的主题演讲中表示，东京、华盛顿和其他志同道合的盟友必须表现出为台湾“战斗的决心”由于两岸局势“向紧急状态倾斜”。

;

;麻生太郎长期直言不讳地支持台湾，他在 2021 年表示日本不应对军事视而不见，此举激怒了北京麻生太郎的访问和言论肯定会进一步激怒北京，因为北京已将台湾视为其领土，必须如有必要，可以使用武力将其重新控制。

;

;北京已警告承认其的国家而不是台北，不要与这个自治岛屿进行官方接触。包括日本和美国在内的大多数国家都不承认台湾是一个独立国家，但反对任何单方面武力改变两岸现状的行为。

;

;台湾国际组织负责人王恭义台北智库战略研究会表示，此次访港是两岸关系改善的进一步迹象。

;

;“日本过去在处理两岸关系方面非常谨慎， ”王说。

;

;日本称北京对台湾的军事优势正在迅速增强

;

;但北京在台湾海峡扩大兵力，并在靠近日本的海域（包括宫古海峡）进行军事行动。王说，冲绳和宫古群岛的问题促使东京通过加强与冲绳岛的接触来修改其两岸政策。

;

;“例如，台湾副总理郑文灿今年 6 月访问日本，去年日本前首相安倍晋三被枪杀后不久，副总统赖清德就以所谓私人名义前往东京吊唁，这是双方关系更加密切的迹象。”

;

;据台湾国防部报道，周三，中国人民解放军派出了 25 架战机和 5 艘军舰在台湾周围执行任务，其中 10 架跨越了台湾海峡与大陆的中线。< /p>; Wed, 09 Aug 2023 20:20:02 +0800 TikTok owner ByteDance ratchets up internal test of AI chatbot ‘Grace’ as ChatGPT-like service gets tepid reception from some employeeshttps://www.scmp.com/tech/big-tech/article/3230536/tiktok-owner-bytedance-ratchets-internal-test-ai-chatbot-grace-chatgpt-service-gets-tepid-reception?utm_source=rss_feed

;;

;TikTok 所有者字节跳动已在全公司范围内加大了对其中文人工智能 (AI) 的测试力度。 ）聊天机器人“Grace”，作为这家科技独角兽创建类似 ChatGPT 服务的最新尝试，迄今为止，一些员工反应冷淡。

;

;Grace 聊天机器人以“your AI bud”为口号进行推广目前只有字节跳动企业邮箱账户持有人可以通过其网站gracebot.cn登录并使用该服务。

;

;与中国以外广泛使用的主要人工智能聊天机器人（例如OpenAI的ChatGPT和谷歌的Bard）相比据当地媒体 36Kr 周一报道，字节跳动的一位代表称 Grace“还不成熟”，“落后于海外领先的 [AI 聊天机器人]”。

;

;周二，另一位字节跳动的代表表示在一份电子邮件声明中，Grace“将仅在中国市场上市”，同时承认该聊天机器人“目前正在接受更多内部测试”。

;

;与 ChatGPT 一样，Grace 也是采用生成式 AI 算法构建的，用于创建新内容，包括音频、代码、图像、文本、模拟和视频。这一领域最近取得的突破有可能彻底改变人们内容创作的方式。

;

;然而，Grace 目前的状况表明，字节跳动仍然落后于其他已经在全国范围内开展了试点的中国大型科技公司。他们的人工智能聊天机器人。

;

;几位使用过 Grace 的员工一致认为，字节跳动的聊天机器人未能给人留下深刻的印象。这些员工要求匿名，因为他们无权接受媒体采访。

;

;周二，一名员工引用了聊天机器人对“Hi Grace”这个简单问候语的令人困惑的反应作为例子。它说：“抱歉，我不是格蕾丝。我是 Grace。”

;

;TikTok 所有者字节跳动正在测试 AI 聊天机器人以挑战 ChatGPT

;

;另一名员工周二表示，当 Grace 尝试了十几次才获得聊天机器人生成一些营销文案。

;

;该员工表示，Grace 生成的所有文案都遭到了她的“反对”。

;

;虽然字节跳动继续在全公司范围内对 Grace 进行测试，但一名员工声称他们不会因为该服务迄今为止的表现而“抱有希望”。

;

;在 Grace 之前，字节跳动首次报告在生成人工智能方面的突破是在 5 月份，当时这家总部位于北京的公司发布了在社交媒体上表示，“Tako”的开发处于“早期阶段”。这款人工智能工具原本应该帮助菲律宾特定用户在其热门短视频应用 TikTok 上搜索内容。

;

;随着更严格的法律的到来，苹果从中国商店中删除了类似 ChatGPT 的应用

;

;目前，中国政府尚未正式批准任何国内的ChatGPT式服务。

;

;本地人工智能聊天机器人服务，包括百度的Ernie Bot、商汤科技的SenseChat、科大讯飞的SparkDesk和阿里巴巴集团控股的统一钱文都被纳入“考虑范围”。在拥有全球最多互联网人口的中国，“试点模式”正在兴起。阿里巴巴拥有《南华早报》。

;

;一些早期的 Ernie Bot 用户将其与中文版的 ChatGPT 进行了比较。

;

;百度的 Ernie Bot 将在长城汽车的汽车中亮相

;

;其他中国大型科技公司在为不同行业的各种应用开发大型语言模型（LLM）（用于训练聊天机器人的技术）方面也领先于字节跳动。 LLM 是深度学习人工智能算法，可以使用非常大的数据集来识别、总结、翻译、预测和生成内容。

;

;相比之下，字节跳动在 6 月底推出了一个云计算平台，用于托管由其他公司。云计算服务使公司能够通过互联网购买、销售、租赁或分发一系列软件和其他数字资源作为按需服务，就像来自电网的电力一样。

;

; Wed, 09 Aug 2023 19:20:03 +0800 Pakistan to dissolve parliament amid fears, uncertainty over freedom and fairness of general electionhttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/politics/article/3230520/pakistan-dissolve-parliament-amid-fears-uncertainty-over-freedom-and-fairness-general-election?utm_source=rss_feed

;Pakistan's national assembly was due to be dissolved on Wednesday at the end of its five-year term, amid growing uncertainty about when the country's next general election would be held.

;

;An expected postponement could lead to the polls being conducted in early 2024 instead of November as scheduled, said ministers and election commission officials.

;

;The delay has added to concerns about the freedom and fairness of the coming election, after former prime minister Imran Khan was banned by the Election Commission of Pakistan on Tuesday from contesting any poll for the next five years.

;

;The ban was triggered by Khan's court conviction on Saturday for “corrupt practices” arising from the illegal sale of state gifts.

;

;However, the ex-leader's fate is widely believed to have been sealed on May 9, when supporters of his Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party attacked military installations in response to Khan's previous arrest for ignoring repeated summons from the country's anti-corruption watchdog.

;

;Pakistan's army, which has dominated national politics for nearly 70 years, accused Khan and his aides of attempting to incite a mutiny within its officer cadre as a prelude to a coup against the government.

;

;Nonetheless, Khan remains popular, and an election in which he and his party are denied a level playing field would yield “short-term superficial” stability that would be “illusionary at best”, according to Fahd Humayun, an assistant professor of political science at Tufts University in the United States.

;

;“It is not going to provide long-term political and economic stability, simply because the election is not going to be representative of popular will,” he said.

;

;Jailed ex-PM Imran Khan barred from Pakistan politics for five years

;

;Under immense pressure from the military, most PTI politicians influential enough to win national or provincial assembly seats have already deserted the party.

;

;This makes it challenging for the PTI to field enough strong candidates in the general election to stand any chance of winning.

;

;Khan and the PTI were ushered into power in 2018 after a general election marred by interference by the military and supreme court.

;

;Instead of focusing on good governance as the military had envisioned, the PTI administration zeroed in on hateful rhetoric against the leaders of rival parties and imprisoned most of them.

;

;Meanwhile, Pakistan's economy teetered ever closer to a Sri Lanka-like default under the PTI government as it failed to comply with the terms of an International Monetary Fund (IMF) balance of payments support programme, which it negotiated in 2019.

;

;Khan extended his bombast to the army's top generals after they withdrew their support, paving the way for his removal as prime minister via a vote of no confidence in April 2022.

;

;Having helped him rise to power, the Pakistani army now “feels compelled to deal with the consequences of the polarisation Khan has unleashed”, said Husain Haqqani, a former Pakistani ambassador.

;

;“Pakistan's politics have entered a stage where, unless all parties agree to the rules of the game, there is no way of avoiding some instability and uncertainty,” he said.

;

;While Khan and his followers “may not have the street power to force their point, they will remain an irritant”, said Haqqani, currently a scholar at Washington's Hudson Institute and the Anwar Gargash Diplomatic Academy in Abu Dhabi.

;

;The coalition that replaced Khan's administration last year was led by parties that the army had previously sought to sideline in favour of a so-called hybrid democracy system.

;

;Rather than attempting to reduce the military's political role, however, Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and his allies have worked closely with it to prevent Khan from making a comeback with the help of sympathetic generals and judges of the Supreme Court.

;

;The Sharif-led coalition enacted controversial laws during the final months of the national assembly's five-year tenure, which have formally enhanced the military's role in civilian governance.

;

;In part, this is meant to reassure the IMF, China and other creditors that Pakistan will remain committed to fixing its finances, irrespective of who wins the next election.

;

;Sharif's government secured a new standby financial assistance package from the IMF on July 13 after taking tough measures to rein in Pakistan's financial and balance of payments deficits.

;

;To curb resurgent terrorist attacks by the Pakistani Taliban movement and separatists in western Balochistan province, the national assembly on Monday amended the official secrets act to grant the military's intelligence agencies sweeping powers to arrest anyone merely perceived as an enemy of the state.

;

;Critics have warned that the amended law gravely undermines civil rights and could be used by the military to muzzle legitimate democratic dissent.

;

;The amendments “read like an autocrat's wish list”, according to an editorial published by Dawn, Pakistan's leading English-language newspaper.

;

;In recent interviews, Sharif defended these moves as a “whole-of-government” approach to addressing Pakistan's challenges.

;

;“Notwithstanding its undemocratic aspects”, this approach was seen by anti-Khan politicians “as their only option to maintain the army's support”, Haqqani said.

;

;But the military's attempts to configure national outcomes “of course put a big question mark” not only on the credibility of the next election, but also on the mandate of the government which would subsequently be formed, said Tufts University's Humayun.

;

;“It will be a government that lacks political legitimacy, at least in the democratic sense,” he said.

;

;This would make it “much harder” for Pakistan's next government “to take the difficult decisions needed” as far as the economy and national security are concerned, Humayun said.

;A day after a confrontation with the Philippines, China's state broadcaster highlighted the PLA's role in defending the South China Sea by airing an interview with the captain of the Chinese navy's largest helicopter carrier.

;

;CCTV aired the interview with Zhang Meiyu, captain of the Hainan, the People's Liberation Army Navy's largest amphibious landing helicopter dock (LHD), on Sunday.

;

;“My dream is one day we are able to fully and independently protect our maritime rights and interests on our own ancestral sea,” Zhang was quoted as saying.

;

;“Ancestral sea” is a common reference in Chinese state propaganda to the South China Sea, while the Hainan is part of the PLAN's South Sea Fleet that oversees the region.

;

;China claims most of the South China Sea while the Philippines, Vietnam, Malaysia and Brunei all have overlapping claims.

;

;Zhang said his 40,000-tonne vessel was a steel “mobile city on the sea and a fortress for naval combat”. He said it could host various forces, including helicopters, tanks, amphibious vehicles and other supplies on the high seas.

;

;The Hainan was the first Type 075 amphibious assault ship to be commissioned, going into service in April 2021, followed by sister ships the Guangxi in December 2021 and the Anhui last year. At least one vessel has been observed under construction and four more are reportedly planned.

;

;The Type 075 LHD has a 232-metre-long flat flight deck to operate six helicopters simultaneously. With huge hangar space inside, it can carrying up to 30 helicopters, or 35 amphibious vehicles and three large air-cushioned landing craft, and nearly 1,000 marines.

;

;The ship has a vehicle gate on each side, allowing the amphibious vehicles to easily drive in and out, according to Zhang.

;

;The Hainan was declared combat ready in 2022 and reportedly trained in the South China Sea and the western Pacific this year.

;

;When the Type 075 was first introduced, military observers said that while the massive LHD was more than adequate to overwhelm any rival claimant of the South China Sea islands and reefs, it had more important roles in a potential Taiwan operation or as part of Beijing's projection of power over bigger distances.

;

;“We must be able to fight on faraway oceans,” Zhang said. “We are also moving ever farther into the oceans to safeguard the various interests of our country and its people overseas.”

;

;Zhang was among 13 Chinese military personnel praised by the central propaganda department and the military's political work department as role models on July 31, the eve of the 96th anniversary of the founding the PLA.

;

;The programme was broadcast at a time when disputes in the South China Sea have sparked fresh tensions between China and its neighbours.

;

;US Navy sailor's mum encouraged him to pass information to China: prosecutor

;

;The show was aired one day after a heated confrontation between the Chinese coastguard and a Filipino supply vessel near the Second Thomas Shoal, known in China as Renai Jiao, in the Spratly Islands, when the Chinese side used water cannons to warn off the Filipino vessel.

;

;Manila summoned the Chinese ambassador to protest while Beijing defended its manoeuvre as “professional and restrained”.

;Hong Kong's transport authority revealed on Wednesday that industry players had applied to import 1,600 mainland Chinese minibus and coach drivers, accounting for 94 per cent of a quota granted under a government scheme to bring in workers.

;

;The authorities said a cross-departmental group composed of representatives from the Transport and Logistics Bureau, the Transport Department and the Labour Department would review the applications. The work was expected to be completed in late September.

;

;The Transport and Logistics Bureau revealed that the Labour Importation Scheme for the sector had received 118 applications in the public light bus and coach category from holders of passenger service operator licences to import about 1,600 drivers.

;

;“Without affecting local driving tests, the Transport Department will provide additional test slots depending on the number of candidates, aiming to conduct driving tests for imported drivers in batches as soon as possible,” a spokesman said.

;

;The government's initiative to alleviate a manpower crunch in the city's construction, aviation and transport sectors seeks to bring in 20,000 workers.

;

;Transport operators can hire up to 900 minibus and 800 coach drivers, with operators expected to source workers from the mainland. So far, the applications accounted for 94 per cent of the 1,700 quota.

;

;

;The bureau's spokesman added the cross-departmental group would continue to strictly monitor the scheme, allowing an appropriate number of drivers to be imported to maintain the reliability and stability of public transport services while safeguarding local employment opportunities.

;

;The spokesman added it would take about a month for imported drivers to complete training, take pre-employment courses and pass the driving test.

;

;Lawmaker Frankie Ngan Man-yu said the number of applications received during the first round, which closed on Monday, indicated the high demand for imported drivers. He added some minibus operators planned to request a fare increase because of the cost of importing drivers.

;

;

;“Apart from necessary training and exams including the road test that must be conducted in Hong Kong, other training can be conducted on the mainland to reduce the costs incurred by employers during the waiting period for imported drivers to obtain Hong Kong driving licences, including accommodation and transport arrangements,” Ngan said.
